body_html:
The system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 6.4.

I tried Yarosalv's answer to use /usr/local/packages/python/2.7.10-anaconda/bin/ipython notebook but it doesn't work for me.

I'm using anaconda, but there is only one root environment. From the error message it seems that the ipython is correctly configured to use anaconda python. Moreover, tensorflow works fine for me in the terminal in ipython, it just breaks in the notebook interface.

body:
The system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 6.4.

I tried Yarosalv's answer to use `/usr/local/packages/python/2.7.10-anaconda/bin/ipython notebook` but it doesn't work for me.

I'm using `anaconda`, but there is only one root environment. From the  error message it seems that the ipython is correctly configured to use anaconda python. Moreover, tensorflow works fine for me in the terminal in ipython, it just breaks in the notebook interface.
